newsitem.title: UK: NWE fuel - HS under bearish pressure, but holds.
newsitem.headline: NWE fuel - HS under bearish pressure, but holds.

text.p: High sulphur cracked fuel oil came under some bearish pressure today as dealers talked of a concerted effort to push prices lower by certain players.
But while prices were seen steady to marginally softer, the fundamental lack of product in the region should prevent a dramatic fall, traders said.

A high sulphur cargo out of Scandinavia for early October was heard offered at $107 fob NWE compared with $110 last Friday. One trader said there had been offers as low as $112 cif NWE, but other dealers said stocks in the NWE are not high and that two utility shorts will have to be met next week.

Low sulphur cracked cargoes were assessed unchanged around $118-120 fob NWE. Two deals done on Wednesday out of ARA were both headed into the main Med buyer. One was at high fob NWE +$1.50 the other at an unconfirmed mid cif NWE quotes delivered.
On Thursday a trader was thought to have picked up a very high density 30 kt cargo at $116.50 fob NWE and demand was understood to remain on behalf of a trader looking for blending material.
The high and low sulphur barge markets were very quiet with only one trade seen at $113 fob ARA.
